keyPolicies.policyDescription: Raising the tax threshold to at least £12,500, which would result in a tax cut of £825 for working people since 2010 and an extra £400. This is part of a broader goal to achieve a fairer tax system in the UK.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Wealthier Contribution and Council Tax Band
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Introducing a new Council tax band for properties worth over £2 million, expected to raise £1.7 billion for deficit reduction.
Making the 'triple lock' pension rises each year permanent.

mentions.candidate: Robin Long is a family man who lives locally with his wife and son. He is a scientist at Lancaster University and is committed to achieving a fairer tax system in the UK. If elected as your MP he would also personally fight to ensure decent pension rises each year by making the 'triple lock' permanent.

housing.content: Introducing a new Council tax band for properties worth over £2 million is expected to raise £1.7 billion for deficit reduction.

leaflet.personalStatement: Robin Long is standing for the Liberal Democrats here, and lives locally with his wife and son. He is a scientist at Lancaster University and is committed to achieving a fairer tax system in the UK. If elected as your MP he would also personally fight to ensure decent pension rises each year by making the 'triple lock' permanent.

images.caption: Robin Long with a description of his family background, professional role, and political commitments.
